Fix bug on Filter feature on multiple skill inputs
commitResults.messageBody:
Filter and Sort command has a bug that is unresponsive when the user
enters the filter or sort command with multiple skills or skills with
non-alphanumeric characters.

Filter Command now accepts multiple skills as filter criteria.

Additional tests and testutils are also added in this commit.

Partially fixes #56

commitResults.messageTitle: Add tests for PersonContainsSkillPredicate
feat: Add undo and redo feature to HackNet
commitResults.messageBody:
When a user makes an error(e.g. deleting a wrong person from HackNet),
the user has to manually undo the previous operation, adding the person
back into HackNet in this specific example. This may be too troublesome
for them and a undo feature would be very helpful in reverting HackNet
back to that state.

Undo and Redo function only available for Add and Remove commands,
more commands will be supported later.

Tests and documentation will be added in a later commit.

See also: #72

commitResults.messageTitle: Adapt UserGuide to HackNet
fix checkstyle issue
Rename tag to team
commitResults.messageBody:
HackNet allows user to tag a person with miscellaneous information.

HackNet should show which team a person is already belonging to,
 as well as enable to add and edit the information of a person in the
 addressbook. Tagging feature in AB3 is not an important function to
 HackNet.

 Renaming the tags to team will meet the requirement in the shortest
 time period and least effort.

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve readability by changing various names in java and json files
Make new command that edits skillset of multiple persons at once
Introduce SetSkills command
commitResults.messageBody:
The only way to edit the skill section of a many persons in the
addressbook is to use the edit command multiple times.

Providing a one line command reduces the User effort to do the same job.

commitResults.messageTitle: Change setskills command to batchedit command
commitResults.messageBody:
The user can not only edit skills but also teams of multiple persons in
the addressbook.

commitResults.messageTitle: Let argument be separated by space if they are same type in BatchEdit
commitResults.messageBody:
BatchEditCommand accepts arguments in the format such as
`batchedit t/Orbital t/CS2106 s/java_100 s/python_80`.

Having to type t/ multiple times is not efficient.

Typing the same prefixes multiple times is not needed now, as the same
job is done with the following format.
`batchedit t/Orbital CS2106 s/java_100 python_80`

commitResults.messageTitle: Allow team name and skill names to have spaces inside
commitResults.messageBody:
Arguments for teams and skills are separated by space in batchedit
command, which means that the team and skill name itself cannot include
a space.

Some skills and team names are better expressed with spaces inside.

Regex for splitting the keywords were changed from a space character to
a comma which or with or without whitespace characters around. Regex
that checks for valid team and skillname was also changed to allow for
spaces inside.

commitResults.messageTitle: Make Command syntax more generous for skillname
commitResults.messageBody:
Parser removes space characters around skillname before making a skill
object. Relevant to Edit and BatchEdit command.

commitResults.messageTitle: Adjust SortCommandParserTest to conform to new skillname format.
Update Userguide.md to match the new syntax for batchedit
Allow editing of teams and skills of a person to be cumulative
commitResults.messageBody:
Using Edit command to edit a person's teams or skills is not cumulative.

Users would typically are better off with cumulative edit, as one would
normally find out that a person in the addressbook are capable of one
more skill that the user did not know of. In that case, user would not
want to type every skill the person has that the User already stored in
HackNet again.

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve error message for invalid indices n valid pattern for skill name
Resolved conflicts from the main branch
Migrate batchedit feature from batchedit command to editcommand
commitResults.messageBody:
BatcheditCommand had to use private Editpersondescriptor class from
EditCommand by making it public, increasing the coupling between the
two classes.

Decreased coupling and clear distinction between features of command
makes it easier to maintain the codebase.

`edit` command now detects whether multiple indices has been given by
the user, and performs what `batchedit` would do with the same
arguments.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update UserGuide.md to accomodate the feature update in `edit` command
Ammend EditCommandTest to conform to the new syntax and features
`add` command now accepts values for teams and skills separated by `,`
commitResults.messageBody:
`add` command accepts multiple values for teams and skills by forcing
the user to specify `/t` and `/s` before every value. This is
inconsistent with `batchedit` and `edit` commands which accepts multiple
values by making user separate each value through `,`.

Consistent style of argument passing helps HackNet be more intuitive to
Users.

commitResults.messageTitle: Change address to GitHub username field
commitResults.messageBody:
There is a need to add a new field for GitHub
username in evolving AB3 to HackNet. We also
no longer need the address field in HackNet.

Since these two fields are similar, let's change
the address field to a github username field instead
of adding a separate field entirely.

Fixes: AY2122S2-CS2103T-W13-3/tp#22

commitResults.messageTitle: Add functionality to navigate user input history using up and down arrow keys.
Update UG with new feature: navigating user input history
Fix bugs present in the feature navigate user input history
commitResults.messageBody:
When users navigate to a previous user input before clearing the commandline and re-entering a new command, the user input history order was messed up.
This was due to the indexing of the user input history not being reset each time the user enters an input.
Refactored the class from TextFieldStorage.java to UserInputHistory.java.
